channel.title: Deprecation error while compiling please help [SOLVED BY GOOGLE]
channel.description:
[b]Ok, turns out it's just a warning and it compiles anyway. I feel like an idiot for spending 30 minutes trying to fix this when there wasn't a problem at all.[/b]
Ok, i've looked into this as far as I can get so i'm not just leeching here.
I'm using FireScape V4, I try to add new objects to client.java, but they don't appear, so I figure I need to compile. I download the newest JDK and change the .bat so it uses the folder.
[b]Edit: This error came up while compiling:[/b] [code=java]Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
[b]Then I put -Xlint:deprecation after "C:/program files/java/jdk1.6.0_02/bin/javac" and this happens:[/b] [code=java]stream.java:238: warning: [deprecation] getBytes(int,int,byte[],int) in java.lan g.String has been deprecated s.getBytes(0, s.length(), buffer, currentOffset); ^ 1 warning Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
I looked further into it and found the line it's talking about. Multiple attempts at changing the line just produce further errors. Can someone please tell me what i'm doing wrong? Here's the section that's wrong. [code=java] public void writeString(java.lang.String s) { s.getBytes(0, s.length(), buffer, currentOffset); currentOffset += s.length(); buffer[currentOffset++] = 10; }[/code]
Thankyou for your time.
[b]EDIT: I HAVE TRIED RUNSERVER + COMPILER FROM THE TUTORIALS SECTION WITH NO SUCCESS[/b]

item.title: Deprecation error while compiling please help [SOLVED BY GOOGLE]
item.dc:creator: @Grady Grady
item.description:
@Grady wrote:

Ok, turns out it’s just a warning and it compiles anyway. I feel like an idiot for spending 30 minutes trying to fix this when there wasn’t a problem at all.

Ok, i’ve looked into this as far as I can get so i’m not just leeching here.

I’m using FireScape V4, I try to add new objects to client.java, but they don’t appear, so I figure I need to compile. I download the newest JDK and change the .bat so it uses the folder.

Edit: This error came up while compiling:

Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. Press any key to continue . . .

Then I put -Xlint:deprecation after “C:/program files/java/jdk1.6.0_02/bin/javac” and this happens:

stream.java:238: warning: [deprecation] getBytes(int,int,byte[],int) in java.lan g.String has been deprecated s.getBytes(0, s.length(), buffer, currentOffset); ^ 1 warning Press any key to continue . . .

I looked further into it and found the line it’s talking about. Multiple attempts at changing the line just produce further errors.
Can someone please tell me what i’m doing wrong?
Here’s the section that’s wrong.

public void writeString(java.lang.String s) { s.getBytes(0, s.length(), buffer, currentOffset); currentOffset += s.length(); buffer[currentOffset++] = 10; }

Thankyou for your time.

EDIT: I HAVE TRIED RUNSERVER + COMPILER FROM THE TUTORIALS SECTION WITH NO SUCCESS

Read full topic
item.source: Deprecation error while compiling please help [SOLVED BY GOOGLE]
